title: Mean Value Theorem with particle motion

content.question: For time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>t</mtext><mo>≥</mo><mtext>1</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeiDaiabgwMiZkaabgdaaaa@3965@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the position of a particle moving along the x-axis is given by <math><semantics><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGWbGaaiikaiaadshacaGGPaGaeyypa0ZaaOaaa8aabaWdbiaa dshaaSqabaGccqGHsislcaaIYaaaaa@3D45@</annotation></semantics></math> . At what time t in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>1</mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext>t</mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext>16</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C76@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the instantaneous velocity of the particle equal to the average velocity of the particle over the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>1</mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext>t</mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext>16</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C76@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
